meta.title: Home - Boulder Valley School District

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Home, K12 education colorado boulder valley

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2

div.div:
BVSD is a leader in Colorado and beyond in academic excellence and instruction innovation. Our outstanding classroom teachers, exemplary schools, and programs support student achievement.
Learn More

The Boulder Valley Board of Education has seven members who each represent one of seven different districts throughout the geographical area of BVSD.
Learn More

img.alt: A student addresses the Board of Education during a meeting.

div.div:
Boulder Valley School District's teams are dedicated to supporting the district's mission of educating students.
Learn More

Learn about the Boulder Valley School District's biggest projects.
Learn More

img.alt: two boys smiling by their lockers

div.div:
Informed and involved parents are a key to student success, so in the Boulder Valley School District we are dedicated to providing families with all the resources they need.
Learn More

BVSD has 56 schools in 11 different communities. All offer BVSD's high-caliber curriculum and instruction, but each has the autonomy to meet the needs of its students and communities.
Learn More

Stay up-to-date on BVSD events and download the academic calendar.
Learn More

BVSD is committed to hiring diverse candidates who bring high quality skills and knowledge. We are looking for individuals who have a growth mindset and are seeking opportunities to collaborate with colleagues and the community to create an exceptional learning experience for kids. We hope you will join our team.
Learn More

The Boulder Valley School District is dedicated to having a collaborative relationship with its stakeholders. We welcome your feedback.
Learn More

li.a: Boulder Community School of Integrated Studies (BCSIS)
1a: Create a standards-based scope and sequence for PreK-12
1b: Define and implement a common and aligned instructional model and practices
3a: Create a tiered system of school requirements, supports, and accountability metrics which drive the allocation of resources
3c: Create a system to monitor and assess academic return on investment for current and future programs
5a: Establish a system for strategically managing existing partnerships and building new partnerships
6a: Deﬁne and put into practice culturally responsive principles and best practices that challenge inequity and bias
Negotiated Agreements, Terms & Conditions and Salary Schedules
Student, Family and Community Technical Resources
Academic, Health, and Attendance Data Collection
Zero Waste and Green Star Schools
Tools and Partners for Greening Your School
Rules for Safe School Bus Riding

section.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsSlideshow fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailLarge fsItemCount_7 fsSlideshowHorizontal

div.p: As home learning is in full gear, BVSD has been seeking to build community and bring staff and students together in new and unique ways.

Art, Music and Movement are great ways to bring people together, even in a virtual world. To kick off this community building, BVSD is launching a collaborative art project, with ‘heart’ as the theme.

Wednesday is the 50th Anniversary of Earth Day. BVSD schools are at the forefront of sustainability with 40 Green Star Schools and 49 schools with EV charging stations. Discover how BVSD schools have moved to be more sustainable and what you can do while staying home.

div.title: Outside every day: More important now than ever

img.alt: Outside every day: More important now than ever

div.a: Outside every day: More important now than ever

div.p: For the past month, families across Boulder Valley have been hunkered down at home, as most people abide by the statewide Stay at Home order. While this social distancing is crucially important to slow the spread of COVID-19, our partners in public health and other community organizations are encouraging families to stay active and to get outside – even if it is just in their immediate surroundings

This third episode focused on public health around COVID19 and included a talk with special guest Jeff from Boulder County Public Health along with staff from our Health Services, Food Services, and Community Schools teams.

To make sure all students were prepared for home learning, staff created backpacks of supplies, learning materials, and books. Staff volunteers distributed these to students over three different days at nine locations across the district. "It's all together for all students and families," says Angel Stobaugh, Director of Language Arts and Humanities.

div.a: Chromebook distribution connects students to school at home

div.p: Our goal is to connect all students with devices and the internet at home so they can fully engage in their learning. Over 7,000 devices have been distributed for students across the district, and our IT team has been working with families who need the internet through a variety of different options.

Home learning is in full swing as we wrap up week 2. It has been a heavy lift for everyone involved. While not everything worked perfectly out of the gate, we appreciate everyone’s patience and flexibility.
Need Assistance? See this page for Community Resources

p.a: Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment

span.b: Now is the time. Make sure you and your family are counted.

br.b: The Boulder Valley School District encourages all of our families and community members to participate in Census 2020. It is incredibly important to BVSD and our entire community, because it impacts how much money is available for education, school lunch and much, much more.

div.class: fsElement fsSharedContainer panel-02 panel-full-width panel-full-boundary banner-blue

div.div: We are proud to be BVSD

div.p: We provide a comprehensive and innovative approach to education and graduate successful, curious, lifelong learners who confidently confront the great challenges of their time.

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsSlideshow fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailXLarge fsItemCount_5 fsSlideshowHorizontal

div.title: bus driver standing in front of buses and mountains

img.alt: bus driver standing in front of buses and mountains

strong.br:
“It integrates well with
my lifestyle in Boulder."
